alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 4:09AM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills possible. Some significant icing possible. The ice will result in difficult travel conditions, including during the morning commute on Friday. Wind chills could range from 18 to 25 degrees. Total ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch are possible. * WHERE...Portions of Deep South Texas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Watch, 12 AM to 9 AM Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Thursday night through Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Cold wind chills as low as 18 degrees will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Watch means there is the potential for a combination of very cold air and the wind to create dangerously low wind chill values. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
